tool.name: Hydrogen Bond Analysis using VMD
tool.description: between two segments of a trajectory
tool.command: ln -s '$__tool_directory__/hbonds.tcl' ./hbonds.tcl && #if $trajin.is_of_type("dcd"): vmd -pdb '$strin' -dcd '$trajin' -dispdev text -e '$hbonds_inp' &>> verbose.txt #elif $trajin.is_of_type("xtc"): vmd -gro '$strin' -xtc '$trajin' -dispdev text -e '$hbonds_inp' &>> verbose.txt #end if

configfiles.configfile:
source hbonds.tcl
set sele1 [atomselect $molid "$sele1"] set sele2 [atomselect $molid "$sele2"]
hbonds -sel1 \$sele1 -sel2 \$sele2 -writefile yes -ang $angle -dist $distance -plot no -DA both -type all -outfile hbond.txt -detailout detail.txt quit

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool calculates hydrogen bonds between two segments of a system in a molecular dynamics trajectory.
_____
.. class:: infomark
**Input**
- Trajectory file (DCD/XTC). - PDB file. - Segment IDs of the two segments.
_____
.. class:: infomark
**Output**
- Number of H-bonds for each time step and and their occupancy.
